item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: Denver that @mati_onorato wanted to travel to Europe with his national ID because it was his first trip and didn’t know he needed passports.
I think this girl was doing something about k pop starts and nfts. I ask my self how did it ended.
item.dc:creator: @fran_aligned

item.title: RT by @fede_intern: This is a good take. Ethereum doesn’t need a milady culture, or go get rid of femboy, soybean whatever, it just needs to understand its users and want to win more than anything else. And be absolutely relentless about it.

item.title: I’m realizing that the adversaries that @udiWertheimer and @ercwl have in Bitcoin land are the same ones we have in Ethereum land: the podcastors. They just circle jerk and are ultra conservative. They are the opposite of bold builders. I despise them.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: There's $6.186 Trillion dollars in outstanding t bill debt Roughly $98B is tokenized into stablecoins
= ~1.58% of all US debt is settled and traded on Ethereum.
Not bad for a system that didnt exist 10 years ago. Eventually, most global debt will settle on ethereum
item.dc:creator: @CupOJoseph

= ~1.58% of all US debt is settled and traded on Ethereum.

Not bad for a system that didnt exist 10 years ago. Eventually, most global debt will settle on ethereum

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: Don't fret, brother.
Crypto is, and has always been, 99% nonsense grifty garbage/scams/jokes, and 1% fundamental global financial system revolution.
But this 99/1 is based just on quantity of projects.
Considered by market cap, it's more like 75% quality, 25% nonsense. Bitcoin is good. Ethereum is good. Stablecoins are good. Several dozen defi projects are good. Wildly cool technology permeates through all of it, and sound economics underpins its long term growth, though the short term feels often like an appallingly irrational market.
How to cope with this dichotomy?
Embrace the degen frontier and have fun, and recognize that amidst it all, a decentralized financial system is real, is important, and is working. None of it is forced on anyone, after all.
We are building and we are attracting the world toward us... and much of the world simply wants to gamble and have fun. This is okay, and actually provides capital for the important work happening behind the casino.
It is, actually, working.
We are realizing the wildest dreams of those who are into it for all the right reasons, despite the accompanying fantasies of those who aren't.
Just keep building, and build well.
item.dc:creator: @ErikVoorhees
item.description:
Don't fret, brother.

Crypto is, and has always been, 99% nonsense grifty garbage/scams/jokes, and 1% fundamental global financial system revolution.

But this 99/1 is based just on quantity of projects.

Considered by market cap, it's more like 75% quality, 25% nonsense. Bitcoin is good. Ethereum is good. Stablecoins are good. Several dozen defi projects are good. Wildly cool technology permeates through all of it, and sound economics underpins its long term growth, though the short term feels often like an appallingly irrational market.

How to cope with this dichotomy?

Embrace the degen frontier and have fun, and recognize that amidst it all, a decentralized financial system is real, is important, and is working. None of it is forced on anyone, after all.

We are building and we are attracting the world toward us... and much of the world simply wants to gamble and have fun. This is okay, and actually provides capital for the important work happening behind the casino.

It is, actually, working.

We are realizing the wildest dreams of those who are into it for all the right reasons, despite the accompanying fantasies of those who aren't.

Just keep building, and build well.

nitter.freedit.eu/JJcycles/status/1880593347573858527#m

item.title:
Miden is an amazing piece of tech. Bobbin is one of the founders we have worked in our history. Highly recommend you follow him. He is not doing a copy cat L2. He is pushing what is possible in Ethereum. Privacy, scaling, client side proving.
I honestly believe there is no more advanced design in the L2 world.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:

I honestly believe there is no more advanced design in the L2 world.

item.title:
This is a great example of what I mean when I say that Ethereum has a cultural problem.
We’re back because Lubin and Vitalik opened twitter and sent a tweet? Are we really celebrating this?
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern

item.title:
I'm rallying all the fat bald big Ethereum bronze age engineers.
We need to change course.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
I'm rallying all the fat bald big Ethereum bronze age engineers.

We need to change course.

item.title:
I'm realizing that most of the people I'm debating in Ethereum land clearly don't try things in @solana, @Aptos or @SuiNetwork.
I go to conferences, try products, code smart contracts. If you're just trying things of the competitors it means we're very late. We need to change course.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
I'm realizing that most of the people I'm debating in Ethereum land clearly don't try things in @solana, @Aptos or @SuiNetwork.

I go to conferences, try products, code smart contracts. If you're just trying things of the competitors it means we're very late. We need to change course.

item.title: We need to rally together all the Ethereum bronze age to discuss how to change things.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description: We need to rally together all the Ethereum bronze age to discuss how to change things.

item.title:
I’ve just did a swap in solana in a few seconds. It works perfectly well.
Phantom wallet UX is so much better to Metamask.

item.title: RT by @fede_intern: Some takeaways from my fundraising journey in the past weeks: Some VCs focus on one thing—the token event and short-term liquidity. Others understand that we’re building a trust layer for the internet, where bringing people on-chain isn’t just a metric—it’s an asset in itself. Self-sovereign identity and decentralized registries aren’t about speculation. They solve real inefficiencies in governance, commerce, and digital ownership. The projects that prioritize real-world adoption over short-term cycles will define the next era of Web3. I know which side we are on.
item.dc:creator: @fernandezdiego
item.description:
Some takeaways from my fundraising journey in the past weeks:
Some VCs focus on one thing—the token event and short-term liquidity.
Others understand that we’re building a trust layer for the internet, where bringing people on-chain isn’t just a metric—it’s an asset in itself.
Self-sovereign identity and decentralized registries aren’t about speculation. They solve real inefficiencies in governance, commerce, and digital ownership.
The projects that prioritize real-world adoption over short-term cycles will define the next era of Web3.
I know which side we are on.

item.title:
R to @fede_intern: I always liked seeing things firsthand. I went to every Solana breakpoint to understand the vibes and the people building there.
Gonna do the same now with @SuiNetwork and @Aptos now.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
I always liked seeing things firsthand. I went to every Solana breakpoint to understand the vibes and the people building there.

Gonna do the same now with @SuiNetwork and @Aptos now.

item.title:
Me and ⁦@fran_aligned⁩ in Lisboa November 2021 Solana Hacker House near the venue of the first Solana Breakpoint conference.
I was laughing at the woman screaming. She was saying she would pay any builder to help her launch her strange NFT project.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern

item.title:
I've just sent this message to main channel of Lambda.
"Lambda becomes faster, more efficient, more demanding, or dies
We are going to become even more aggressive in our ability to delivery
If you want peace of mind, I recommend leaving the company, we are going to accelerate"
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
